abilities.text: Once per fight, when you [Strike](datasworn:move:classic/combat/strike) or [Clash](datasworn:move:classic/combat/clash), you may fan the hammer to take extra shots and suffer -1 supply. If you do, reroll any dice. On a hit, inflict +2 harm and take +1 momentum.

conditions.text: if you fan the hammer and suffer -1 supply (decide before rolling, once per fight)

abilities.text: When you [Face Danger](datasworn:move:classic/adventure/face_danger) or [Secure an Advantage](datasworn:move:classic/adventure/secure_an_advantage) by making a trick shot, add +1 and take +1 momentum on a hit

conditions.text: if you make a trick shot

abilities.text: When you [Swear an Iron Vow](datasworn:move:classic/quest/swear_an_iron_vow) on your pistol, add +1 and take +1 momentum on a hit. If you set aside a specific bullet with which to fulfil the vow, suffer -1 supply in exchange for an additional +1 momentum on a hit.

conditions.text: if you swear an iron vow on your pistol
if you set aside a specific bullet to fulfil the vow and suffer -1 supply

sharpshooter.name: Sharpshooter
sharpshooter.requirement: If you wield a long rifle...

abilities.text: When you [Secure an Advantage](datasworn:move:classic/adventure/secure_an_advantage) by taking a moment to aim, envision where you intend to land your shot. Then, add +1 and take +1 momentum on a hit

conditions.text: by taking a moment to aim and envision where you intend to land your shot

abilities.text: When you [Enter The Fray](datasworn:move:classic/combat/enter_the_fray) at range, roll +wits and take an additional +1 momentum on a hit as you use the angles and terrain to your advantage

conditions.text: use the angles and terrain to your advantage

abilities.text: When you [Resupply](datasworn:move:classic/adventure/resupply) by hunting, add +1 and take +1 momentum on a hit.
When you [Strike](datasworn:move:classic/combat/strike) a foe and score a strong hit, take +1 momentum as you also knock them back, stun them, or put them off-balance
When you [Strike](datasworn:move:classic/combat/strike) or [Clash](datasworn:move:classic/combat/clash) and burn momentum to improve your result, inflict +2 harm.

When you [Turn the Tide](datasworn:move:classic/combat/turn_the_tide), you may fire with both barrels. If you do (decide before rolling), you may reroll any dice and inflict +1 harm on a strong hit, but count a weak hit as a miss.

two_fisted.name: Two Fisted
two_fisted.requirement: If you wield a two pistols at once...

abilities.text: When you [Strike](datasworn:move:classic/combat/strike) or [Clash](datasworn:move:classic/combat/clash), you may add +2. If you do (decide before rolling), inflict +1 harm on a strong hit and count a weak hit as a miss.
Once per fight, when you [Secure an Advantage](datasworn:move:classic/adventure/secure_an_advantage) +edge by making a bold display of your combat prowess, you may reroll any dice.

conditions.text: by making a bold display of your combat prowess (once per fight)

abilities.text:
When you [Draw the Circle](datasworn:move:classic/relationship/draw_the_circle), choose one (before rolling).

  * Add +2.
  * Take +2 momentum on a hit.

When you create an elixir, choose an effect: Deftness (edge), audacity (heart), vigor (iron), slyness (shadow), or clarity (wits). Then, suffer -1 supply and roll +wits. On a strong hit, you create a single dose. The character who consumes the elixir must [Face Danger](datasworn:move:classic/adventure/face_danger) +iron and score a hit, after which they add +1 when making moves with the related stat until their health, spirit, or momentum fall below +1. On a weak hit, as above, but suffer an additional -1 supply to create it.

create_elixir.name: Create Elixir
create_elixir.text: When you create an elixir, choose an effect: Deftness (edge), audacity (heart), vigor (iron), slyness (shadow), or clarity (wits). Then, suffer -1 supply and roll +wits. On a strong hit, you create a single dose. The character who consumes the elixir must [Face Danger](datasworn:move:classic/adventure/face_danger) +iron and score a hit, after which they add +1 when making moves with the related stat until their health, spirit, or momentum fall below +1. On a weak hit, as above, but suffer an additional -1 supply to create it.

strong_hit.text: On a __strong hit__, you create a single dose. The character who consumes the elixir must [Face Danger](datasworn:move:classic/adventure/face_danger) +iron and score a hit, after which they add +1 when making moves with the related stat until their health, spirit, or momentum fall below +1.

weak_hit.text:
On a __weak hit__, you create a single dose, but suffer an additional -1 supply to create it.

The character who consumes the elixir must [Face Danger](datasworn:move:classic/adventure/face_danger) +iron and score a hit, after which they add +1 when making moves with the related stat until their health, spirit, or momentum fall below +1.

miss.text: On a __miss__, you fail, or your progress is undermined by a dramatic and costly turn of events. [Pay the Price](datasworn:move:classic/fate/pay_the_price).

abilities.text: As above, and you may choose two effects for a single dose, or create two doses of the same effect.
When you prepare an elixir, add +1 and take +1 momentum on a hit.

When you [Sojourn](datasworn:move:classic/relationship/sojourn) and score a weak hit or miss, you may claim the rights of hospitality warranted by your history or position. If you do, roll all dice again and add +1. On a miss, you are refused, and your presumption causes significant new trouble.
When you exert your title or lineage to [Compel](datasworn:move:classic/relationship/compel), add +1 and take +1 momentum on a hit.

conditions.text: When you exert your title or authority

abilities.text: When you forgo your history or position and [Forge a Bond](datasworn:move:classic/relationship/forge_a_bond) as an equal, or when you [Swear an Iron Vow](datasworn:move:classic/quest/swear_an_iron_vow) to serve someone of a lower station, add +1 and take +1 momentum or +1 spirit on a hit.

conditions.text: as an equal, foregoing your title or lineage
to serve someone of a lower station

abilities.text: When you [Face Danger](datasworn:move:classic/adventure/face_danger), [Secure an Advantage](datasworn:move:classic/adventure/secure_an_advantage), or [Compel](datasworn:move:classic/relationship/compel) by lying, bluffing, stealing, or cheating, add +1.
When you [Gather Information](datasworn:move:classic/adventure/gather_information) by investigating a devious scheme, you may roll +shadow (instead of +wits). If you do, take +2 momentum on a hit.

When you [Forge a Bond](datasworn:move:classic/relationship/forge_a_bond) for a relationship founded on a lie, choose one.

  * Keep your secret: Roll +shadow (instead of +heart).
  * Reveal the truth: Roll +heart. On a strong hit, mark a bond twice and take 1 experience. A weak hit counts as a miss.

When you say your daily prayers, you may [Secure an Advantage](datasworn:move:classic/adventure/secure_an_advantage) by asking your god to grant a blessing. If you do, roll +your god’s stat. On a hit, take +2 momentum.

conditions.text: by asking your god to grant a blessing when you say your daily prayers

abilities.text: When you [Swear an Iron Vow](datasworn:move:classic/quest/swear_an_iron_vow) to serve your god on a divine quest, you may roll +your god’s stat and reroll any dice. When you [Fulfill Your Vow](datasworn:move:classic/quest/fulfill_your_vow) and mark experience, take +1 experience.

conditions.text: to serve your god on a divine quest
to serve your god on a divine quest

abilities.text: When you [Sojourn](datasworn:move:classic/relationship/sojourn) by sharing the word of your god, you may roll +your god’s stat. If you do, take +1 momentum on a hit.

conditions.text: By sharing the word of your god

abilities.text: When you [Face Danger](datasworn:move:classic/adventure/face_danger), [Secure an Advantage](datasworn:move:classic/adventure/secure_an_advantage), or [Gather Information](datasworn:move:classic/adventure/gather_information) using your knowledge of tracking, woodcraft, or woodland creatures, add +1.

conditions.text: using your knowledge of tracking, woodcraft, or woodland creatures

abilities.text: When you [Face Danger](datasworn:move:classic/adventure/face_danger) or [Secure an Advantage](datasworn:move:classic/adventure/secure_an_advantage) by hiding or sneaking in the woodlands, add +1 and take +1 momentum on a hit.

conditions.text: by hiding or sneaking in the woodlands

abilities.text: When you [Make Camp](datasworn:move:classic/adventure/make_camp) in the woodlands, you may roll +wits (instead of +supply). If you do, you and your allies each choose 1 more option on a hit.
Once per day, you may reroll all dice on a single non-progress move. If you do, gain +2 momentum on a strong hit and count a weak hit as a miss.
You may [Resupply](datasworn:move:classic/adventure/resupply) by playing a game of chance wherever people may gather. If you cheat at the game, roll +shadow instead of +wits.

conditions.text: by playing a game of chance
by cheating at a game of chance

abilities.text: When you [Sojourn](datasworn:move:classic/relationship/sojourn), on a hit you may, in addition to the options chosen, freely exchange any amount of your party’s supply 1-for-1 to increase everyone’s health, spirit, or momentum as you gamble away the material to reap intangible benefits.

conditions.text: on a hit, exchange supply for health, spirit, or momentum

abilities.text: When you leverage your bad reputation to [Compel](datasworn:move:classic/relationship/compel) or [Secure an Advantage](datasworn:move:classic/adventure/secure_an_advantage), add +1 and take +1 momentum on a hit.

When you [Draw The Circle](datasworn:move:classic/relationship/draw_the_circle), you may roll +shadow. If you do, on a hit you may cheat on one or more boasts, taking the +1 momentum while only seeming to grant your opponent the accompanying advantage

conditions.text: cheat on one of more boast

abilities.text: When you [Sojurn](datasworn:move:classic/relationship/sojourn) and demand aid rather than ask for it, you may roll +iron.  In addition to other results, take +1 momentum on a hit.

conditions.text: demand aid rather than ask for it

abilities.text: When you [Compel](datasworn:move:classic/relationship/compel) someone to avoid violence, add +1 and take +1 momentum on a hit.

When you refuse to [Enter the Fray](datasworn:move:classic/combat/enter_the_fray), you may instead abstain. Roll +heart. On a hit, you avoid combat. On a weak hit, you do so at a cost. On a miss, [Pay the Price](datasworn:move:classic/fate/pay_the_price)

strong_hit.text: On a __strong hit__, you avoid combat.

weak_hit.text: On a __weak hit__, you avoid combat, but at a cost.

miss.text: On a __miss__, you fail, or your progress is undermined by a dramatic and costly turn of events. [Pay the Price](datasworn:move:classic/fate/pay_the_price).

abilities.text: When you [Swear an Iron Vow](datasworn:move:classic/quest/swear_an_iron_vow) to establish or renew peace, you may reroll any dice. When you [Fulfill Your Vow](datasworn:move:classic/quest/fulfill_your_vow) and mark experience, take +1 experience
When you [Resupply](datasworn:move:classic/adventure/resupply) in the wild, add +1 and take -1 momentum on a hit.
On any move result that would allow you to add supply, you may add additional supply 1-for-1 by sacrificing health, spirit or momentum as you sacrifice your well-being for material gain.
When you are [Out of Supply](datasworn:move:classic/suffer/out_of_supply) and would mark unprepared, instead roll +wits. On a hit, move your supply to +1. On a strong hit, also take +1 momentum

strong_hit.text: On a __strong hit__, also take +1 momentum.

hit.text: On a __hit__, move your supply to +1.

abilities.text:
When you [Heal](datasworn:move:classic/health/heal) someone, choose one or both before rolling: 

 * Give +1 additional health on a strong hit, but on a miss they [Endure Harm](datasworn:move:classic/suffer/endure_harm) (2 harm)
 * Give +1 additional health on a strong hit, but count a weak hit as a miss
Spend supply 1-for-1 to give the patient whiskey to drink and a bullet to bite and add +1 to the above roll for each supply spent
You may attempt to heal yourself, as above

When you [Gather Information](datasworn:move:classic/adventure/gather_information) you may reroll any dice. When using this information to [Compel](datasworn:move:classic/relationship/compel) others, add +1.

conditions.text: When using this information to compel others

abilities.text:
When you publish a story that is… 

 • Hopeful, roll +heart 
• Attacking, roll +iron 
• False, roll +shadow 

 On a hit, your story accomplishes what you hoped it would. On a strong hit, also take +1 momentum. On a miss, your story is misinterpreted or perhaps understood all too well. [Pay the Price](datasworn:move:classic/fate/pay_the_price).
Add the trigger “When someone has read a successful story of yours,” to [Forge a Bond](datasworn:move:classic/relationship/forge_a_bond). You need not have met this person
When you [Clash](datasworn:move:classic/combat/clash) or [Strike](datasworn:move:classic/combat/strike) against an enemy who has wounded you, add +1 and take +1 momentum on a hit.

conditions.text: against an enemy who has wounded you

abilities.text: When you [Clash](datasworn:move:classic/combat/clash) or [Strike](datasworn:move:classic/combat/strike) at 0 health, take +2 momentum on a strong hit and +1 momentum on a weak hit

When you [Swear an Iron Vow](datasworn:move:classic/quest/swear_an_iron_vow) for vengeance, you may reroll any dice. When you [Fulfill Your Vow](datasworn:move:classic/quest/fulfill_your_vow) and mark experience, take +1 experience.

When you reject assistance from a community or individual and instead [Face Danger](datasworn:move:classic/adventure/face_danger), [Secure an Advantage](datasworn:move:classic/adventure/secure_an_advantage or [Enter the Fray](datasworn:move:classic/combat/enter_the_fray) alone, add +1 and take +1 momentum on a hit. If you share a bond with your would-be assistant, you must also [Test Your Bond](datasworn:move:classic/relationship/test_your_bond) at +1.
When you [Endure Stress](datasworn:move:classic/suffer/endure_stress), your detached nature lets you roll +1 and take +1 momentum on a hit

When you would [Pay the Price](datasworn:move:classic/fate/pay_the_price) inside a town, you may instead leave town, promising not to return. This works once per town; should you return, the consequences would be dire

When you use the force of the law to [Compel](datasworn:move:classic/relationship/compel) or [Secure an Advantage](datasworn:move:classic/adventure/secure_an_advantage), add +1 and take +1 momentum on a hit. If you use this to arrest a lawbreaker, you may choose to reroll any dice, but count a weak hit as a miss

When you burn momentum to [Gather Information](datasworn:move:classic/adventure/gather_information), envision how your training allows you to persist through the dead ends. Then, take +2 momentum after you reset.

When you [Swear an Iron Vow](datasworn:move:classic/quest/swear_an_iron_vow to uphold the law, you may deputize one other individual. For the duration of the vow: 

 * An ally may use your unlocked Marshal abilities and add +1 to [Aid Your Ally](datasworn:move:classic/relationship/aid_your_ally) when assisting you. 
* An NPC counts as a Kindred asset with one unlocked ability.

follow_the_path.name: Follow the Path

trigger.text: When you travel a well-known path but may still encounter danger...

strong_hit.text: On a strong hit, your journey is efficient and safe. Take +1 momentum

weak_hit.text: On a weak hit, you reach your destination, but not without incident. [Pay the Price](datasworn:move:classic/fate/pay_the_price).

miss.text: On a miss, you are lost or waylaid. [Pay the Price](datasworn:move:classic/fate/pay_the_price) and when you continue your travels you must [Undertake a Journey](datasworn:move:classic/adventure/undertake_a_journey) to reach your destination.

follow_the_path.text:
When you travel a well known path, but may still encounter danger, name your destination and roll. If your strategy is primarily to: 

 * Travel at speed: Roll +edge
 * Travel cautiously: Roll +wits
* Travel with a group: Roll +heart

 On a strong hit, your journey is efficient and safe. Take +1 momentum.
On a weak hit, you reach your destination, but not without incident. [Pay the Price](datasworn:move:classic/fate/pay_the_price). On a miss, you are lost or waylaid. [Pay the Price](datasworn:move:classic/fate/pay_the_price) and when you continue your travels you must [Undertake a Journey](datasworn:move:classic/adventure/undertake_a_journey) to reach your destination.

ride_the_rails.name: Ride The Rails

trigger.text: When you ride a passenger train between two stations...

ride_the_rails.text: When you take a passenger train between two stations, [Follow the Path](datasworn:move:badlands/adventure/follow_the_path). Instead of rolling +stat, roll +supply spent on your ticket. This can range from 0 supply for stowing away with the cargo to 5 supply for luxurious accommodations on a private car. Interpret the results of the roll as normal.

out_of_ammo.name: Out of Ammo

trigger.text: When you use a firearm and roll 1 on your action die...

out_of_ammo.text: When you use a firearm and roll a 1 on your action die, you have used the final bullet and must suffer -1 supply to reload before using it again.

draw_the_circle_revised.name: Draw The Circle

trigger.text: When you challenge someone to a formal duel or accept a challenge...

draw_the_circle_revised.text:
When you challenge someone to a formal duel, or accept a challenge, roll +heart. If you share a bond with this community, add +1.
 On a strong hit, take +1 momentum. You may also choose up to two boasts and take +1 momentum for each.
 On a weak hit, you may choose one boast in exchange for +1 momentum.

 * Grant first shot: Your foe has initiative.
* Use your off hand: your harm is 1.
* Stand tall and refuse to dodge: foe’s harm is +1.
 * Load only one bullet: hit or miss, you’ve got one shot.
 * To the death: One way or another, this fight must end with death. 

 On a miss, you begin the duel at a disadvantage. Your foe has initiative. [Pay the Price](datasworn:move:classic/fate/pay_the_price).

 Then, make moves to resolve the fight. For the classic Western duel many of these moves will be setting up your shot. These moves will still fill up the progress track and prepare you for the final moments. If you are the victor, you may make a lawful demand, and your opponent must comply or forfeit their honor and standing. If you refuse the challenge, surrender,or are defeated, they make a demand of you.

strong_hit.text:
On a __strong hit__, take +1 momentum. You may also choose up to two boasts and take +1 momentum for each. 

 * Grant first shot: Your foe has initiative.
* Use your off hand: your harm is 1.
* Stand tall and refuse to dodge: foe’s harm is +1.
 * Load only one bullet: hit or miss, you’ve got one shot.

weak_hit.text:
On a __weak hit__, you may choose one boast in exchange for +1 momentum.

 * Grant first shot: Your foe has initiative.
* Use your off hand: your harm is 1.
* Stand tall and refuse to dodge: foe’s harm is +1.
 * Load only one bullet: hit or miss, you’ve got one shot.

miss.text: On a miss, you begin the duel at a disadvantage. Your foe has initiative. [Pay the Price](datasworn:move:classic/fate/pay_the_price).

options.description: Some speak of odd doings in the Badlands, but these are nothing but superstitions and old wives’ tales. People of reason know better.
options.quest_starter: Homesteaders a day’s ride out of town have been turning up dead. Local gossip suggests the murders are the work of a ghost or haunt, but there may be more mundane forces at work. What is your connection to these killings? What will you do to stop them?

options.description: Strange occurrences populate the land if you know where to look, and wary folks look elsewhere. Only the foolhardy would venture into the night alone and unarmed..
options.quest_starter: You bear the scars of an attack by an abomination. What was it? Are those scars physical, emotional, or both? How do you seek to make yourself whole again?

options.description: Horrors walk the land and it is only the naive or the lucky who could say otherwise. We must stand in constant defense against them.
options.quest_starter: A group of Badlanders establish a settlement in a territory cursed by a malevolent horror. What evil plagues this land? Why are the Badlanders so intent on settling here? Will you aid them, or attempt to force them to give up this foolish undertaking?

options.description: The religious strictures Back East prevented us from worshipping as we wished. We came West seeking the freedom to pray as our god dictates
options.quest_starter: A missionary arrives in the community to prosthelytize for the old ways. Is it revulsion or fascination that draws you to their words? If the community takes offense at these sermons, how will you react?

options.description: Mayors, councilmen, senators, governors and aldermen all had a hand in dictating how we should live Back East. We came West to organize our own politics to fit our way of life.
options.quest_starter: The vote for statehood is coming up and getting some strong support in many counties. How do you feel about joining the union? How will you ensure that your vision is the one that prevails?

options.description: Back East the rich got richer and the poor got nothing. Out here in the Badlands everyone has a more-or-less equal chance to earn a good living, or even strike it big.
options.quest_starter: Land barons have been buying up cheap acreage and leasing it to those it was intended for. Who do you know that has been squeezed by this practice? What can you do to help them?

options.description: Our forebears slaughtered and subjugated those who lived here before we came to the Badlands. Those who remain have been disenfranchised and pushed to the margins
options.quest_starter: One of the few remaining “free” tribe members approaches you with evidence of your grandparents’ harrowing deeds against their people. What is your reaction? What vow can you swear to try to mitigate the decades old damage?

options.description: A wary peace exists between the Badlanders and those who first lived on the land we occupy. Relationships - commercial, social, and familial - are not uncommon, but can still draw ire from those set in their ways.
options.quest_starter: Someone on one side of the peace has put plans in motion to end it. What do they have to gain from conflict? How can you oppose them without starting a different battle?

options.description: There is open conflict between settler and native. Violence regularly breaks out on both sides, and no one is safe from its reach.
options.quest_starter: A noted combatant has laid down their arms and is trying to make peace. What made them change their ways? How do they hope to end the bloodshed? And what makes you think you can help?

options.description: Our roots Back East are all but forgotten. We have lived in the Badlands for generations and it is all we know.
options.quest_starter: A well-dressed stranger arrives from Back East. What motivated them to come all this way? What is your connection to their business? Will you aid or hinder them?

options.description: Contact with the East is sporadic, but still important. Many still feel a connection to their Eastern kin.
options.quest_starter: Contact with the East is cut off. What caused the disconnection? Who benefits and who suffers from it? How will you reestablish connection?

options.description: Back East thinks we are nothing but their colony and seeks to rule over us as they did before we came to Badlands. Their meddling is constant and oppressive.
options.quest_starter: Some Badlanders have begun to gather in groups and organize against Eastern influence. What is your relationship to these groups? When Back East moves against them, as they are sure to do, how will you react?

options.description: The population of the Badlands is sparse and far spread. Most families live in their own small steadings which are isolated and insular. Gatherings as large as a village are rare and strangers are viewed with suspicion
options.quest_starter: A person unknown to all arrives in your steading. They claim they need help, but it could just as easily be a trap. No one else is likely to offer aid. What do you do?

options.description: Settlements in the Badlands range in size from a steading with a few families to a village of several hundred. Travel and trade between towns is not uncommon.
options.quest_starter: A decades-long feud between two communities has flared into open conflict. What is the cause of this dispute? Do you join in the fight, or swear to put a stop to it?

options.description: We have established a foothold here in the Badlands. Some large towns could even claim the name city, and those dealing in the cattle trade or mining could even be called prosperous
options.quest_starter: Stagecoaches are forced to pay for passage along a trade road. This payment leaves several communities without sufficient winter stores. Who is making these demands? How will you set things right?

options.description: The railroad is for places where people want to go. The Badlands is not such a place. Why would the railroad ever come here?
options.quest_starter: Without the railroad, travel in the Badlands is grueling and dangerous. It’s not rare for a rider to leave a steading and never be seen again. Who do you know that this has happened to? What do you plan to do about it?

options.description: Surveyors from the railroads have started to appear in the Badlands, planning out routes and taking notes. Perhaps even a few small rail lines have already been built.
options.quest_starter: Word is that the railroad is coming to your town. This may mean prosperity, but will definitely mean problems. Are the benefits worth the drawbacks? Do you help or hinder these efforts?

options.description: Rail lines crisscross the Badlands. They are the backbone of trade and models of efficiency. Anywhere that’s anywhere has a station and facilities for passengers, as well as freight
options.quest_starter: A well organized gang of bandits have made it their job to rob the Badlands many trains. They have been getting more violent, and more than money is at risk now. How will you stop these bandits? Or will you join them?

options.description: While folks Back East would think every critter out here is fearsome, there’s nothing roaming these lands anymore that a Badlander would find unusual. Anyone who says different is just telling tales.
options.quest_starter: You were witness to an attack by what you thought was an animal of monstrous proportions. No one believes you. In fact, you are accused of the murder you blame on this beast. How can you prove your innocence? Can you even trust your own memories of the event?

options.description: There are frightful beasts that slither, stalk and stampede throughout the wilds of the Badlands. They ain’t exactly common, but they ain’t exactly as rare as some folks might hope.
options.quest_starter: A prominent Badlander is consumed with the need to bring vengeance upon a specific beast. What makes this creature distinctive? How did it earn the wrath of this Badlander? Do you aid this person in their quest, or act to prevent their blind hate from destroying more than just the beast?

options.description: Beasts of all sorts roam the Badlands. They dwell primarily in the reaches, but range into the settled lands to hunt. There, they often prey on cattle, but attacks on travelers, coaches, or even settlements are not uncommon.
options.quest_starter: Professional slayers earn their keep by killing beasts. This particular slayer, famed throughout the Ironlands for their numerous kills, has gone missing on a hunt. Did they finally meet their match, or is something more nefarious at play. What is your connection to them?

options.description: Shooting irons are rare and precious. If a body owns one, it’s likely the most expensive possession they have, and they’re not liable to let it out of their sight.
options.quest_starter: A prominent member of your steading has had their gun go missing - one of the few guns around. You have been tasked with finding and retrieving it. But it is an awfully nice piece, and once you find it, who could stop you from keeping it?

options.description: Guns are tools. Most folk who work dangerous jobs keep them, but those in more pacific professions have no need of them.
options.quest_starter: An acquaintance of yours who normally carries was caught in a bad spot without their shooting iron. What were the consequences? How do you aim to rectify the situation? And why weren’t they carrying in the first place?

options.description: Rare is the Badlander who isn’t carrying iron, and if you draw down on someone you best expect them to draw back.
options.quest_starter: No one is sure what the spark was that lit the fuse, but someone said or did something untoward and now several bodies are cooling in the town square. Who has asked you to get to the bottom of it and enact the proper justice? Who opposes your efforts? Why might they be right to do so?

options.description: Things in the Badlands ain’t nearly as chaotic as those Back East would have you believe. For the most part folks follow the law, and at least out here we’ve got honest criminals, not besuited businessmen robbing folks with a fountain pen.
options.quest_starter: Someone you know who usually walks the straight and narrow has suddenly committed a criminal act and issought by the law. What did they (allegedly) do? Do you aim to help hide them, help find them, or take another tack?

options.description: Crime ain’t exactly rare here in the Badlands. Folks are just about as likely to do what they wish as what they ought, regardless of what might be written down on a piece of paper.
options.quest_starter: They say it ain’t a crime if you don’t get caught, and you didn’t. But now the ramifications of your seemingly inconsequential act are becoming clear, and you’re starting to get caught in your own conscience. But now it might be too late. What did you do, and how can you make it right despite the long odds?

options.description: The Badlands truly is the Wild West. The only law out here is your will imposed upon another person. Lawbreakers are just as common, if not moreso, than law abiders.
options.quest_starter: A noted gunfighter has styled themselves a self-appointed Marshal and aims to bring law and order to the county. Could this plan ever be successful? Do you aim to help or hinder their efforts? And don’t you have as much claim to appoint yourself Marshal as they do?

options.description: The Badlands are aptly named; there is nothing good here. It is a wasteland as brutal on the eyes as it is on the body, and survival is a constant battle.
options.quest_starter: Seems that a group of someones who ought to have known better founded a town where they shouldn’t have and are now reaping the consequences. It’s hard to tell if famine, drought, or predation will take them out first, but something sure will - unless you help. How do you plan to undo their poor decisions?

options.description: The Badlands are a cruel, but beguiling mistress. Gorgeous vistas and stunning sunsets belie the perils of the wide and dangerous land.
options.quest_starter: As beautiful as it is, the land can be deadly, especially if you end up in the wrong part. That’s why you’ve vowed to map the Badlands. What made you undertake such a vow? Are you working alone? How can you hope to complete it?

options.description: The Badlands are only dangerous if you’re as ignorant as a Back Easter. The landscape is downright verdant if you know where and how to look.
options.quest_starter: A well-heeled Back Easter has heard the siren song of the Badlands and is looking for a tour guide to its many wonders. Coin is coin, and how difficult could it be? Pretty difficult, it turns out. What mistakes does this tinhorn keep making, and why is it not so simple for you to leave their employ?
